intro: Spergularia salsuginea, commonly known as sea sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing, mat-forming species that thrives in coastal environments, particularly in sandy or saltmarsh habitats. The plant is characterized by its small, green, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, pink or white flowers. It is highly tolerant of saline and arid conditions, making it a hardy species adapted to harsh coastal climates. Spergularia salsuginea plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
